Class EntrySetEmptyTests

java.lang.Object
myTest.EntrySetEmptyTests
public class EntrySetEmptyTests extends Object
This test case tests the EntrySet class instances linked to an empty map. Every method of the EntrySet class is tested to ensure the class implementation serves correctly as a view for empty maps. For each method tests are created to ensure correct behavior in normal and edge cases, including correct throwing of exceptions and correct return values and side effects on the underlying map.
See Also:
  • MapAdapter
  • MapAdapter.EntrySet
  • MapAdapter.Entry
Design
This test case aims to verify the correct behavior of empty entry set instances to ensure it correctly serves as a set view for empty maps and implements correctly the HSet interface.
Libraries
JUnit 4.13, Hamcrest 1.3

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      public void setUp()
      Sets up the test environment by initializing an empty MapAdapter through the MapAdapter's default constructor and creating an EntrySet instance obtaining its entry set view.

    • tearDown

      public void tearDown()
      Cleans up the test environment by setting the map and entrySet references to null, allowing for garbage collection.

    • testSize

      public void testSize()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method returns 0 for an empty map.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method returns 0 for an empty map.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method is called on the set view created by the setUp() method. Since the linked map is empty, the method should return 0.
      Preconditions
      The map is correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.size() method returns 0 for an empty map.

      Description

      Preconditions

      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.isEmpty() method returns true for an empty map.

    • testContainsNull

      public void testContainsNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument as not supported by the view.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method is called with null as an argument on the entry set. Since the underlying map does not support null keys, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testContainsNotContainedElement

      public void testContainsNotContainedElement()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.
      Description
      To create a non-contained element, a new MapAdapter instance is created, and an entry is added to it. The entry is then extracted using the iterator of the entry set view of the new map. The MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method is called with this entry on the original entry set. Since the original map is empty thus the new entry is not contained in it, the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated.
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged.
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.contains(Object) method returns false when a non-contained element is passed as an argument.

    • testIteratorNotNull

      public void testIteratorNotNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.iterator() method returns a non-null iterator for an empty entry set.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.iterator() method returns a non-null iterator for an empty entry set.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.iterator() method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is empty, the method should return a non-null iterator that iterates over no elements.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.iterator() method returns a non-null iterator for an empty entry set.

    • testToArray

      public void testToArray()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method returns an empty array for an empty entry set.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method returns an empty array for an empty entry set.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is empty, the method should return an empty array with a length of 0.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray() method returns an empty array with length 0 for an empty entry set.

    • testToArrayNullArray

      public void testToArrayNullArray()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method is called with null as an argument on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the method does not support null arrays, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testToArrayWithBiggerArray

      public void testToArrayWithBiggerArray()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method returns the bigger array when a bigger array is passed as an argument. The method should preserve the elements of the passed array except for the one overwritten by the null terminator.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method returns the bigger array when a bigger array is passed as an argument. The method should preserve the elements of the passed array except for the one overwritten by the null terminator.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method is called with a bigger array than the entry set size on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is empty, the method should return the bigger passed array with a null terminator at position 0 and preserve the remaining elements.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.toArray(Object[]) method returns the array of size 5 with a null terminator at position 0 and preserves the elements of the passed array at positions 1 to 4.

    • testAdd

      public void testAdd()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty entry set.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty entry set.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method is called with a string as an argument on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is a view of an empty map, the method should throw an UnsupportedOperationException as adding elements to an entry set is not allowed.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.add(Object) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty entry set.

    • testRemoveNull

      public void testRemoveNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method is called with null as an argument on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the set does not support null keys, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testRemoveNonContainedNotAnEntry

      public void testRemoveNonContainedNotAnEntry()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method throws ClassCastException when called on a non HMap.HEntry object.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) fails with ClassCastException when the passed element is not an entry.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method is called with a string on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the MapAdapter.EntrySet is designed to contain only HMap.HEntry the MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) should result in a ClassCastException which is asserted to have been thrown.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method throws ClassCastException when called on a non-HMap.HEntry object.

    • testRemoveNonContainedEntry

      public void testRemoveNonContainedEntry()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method returns false when a non-contained entry is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method returns false when a non-contained entry is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method is called with an entry that is not contained in the entry set on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is empty, the method should return false, indicating that the entry was not contained in the entry set. Since the entry set is backed by the map, the map should remain empty after the operation.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map and entry set are unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.remove(Object) method returns false when a non-contained entry is passed as an argument.

    • testContainsAllNull

      public void testContainsAllNull()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method throws a NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method is called with null as an argument on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the method does not accept null collections, it should throw a NullPointerException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map and the entry set are unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method throws NullPointerException when null is passed as an argument.

    • testContainsAllSameElements

      public void testContainsAllSameElements()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns true when called on a collection with the same elements as the entry set.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns true when called on a collection with the same elements as the entry set.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method is called with another MapAdapter's entry set on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is empty, it should contain all elements of the other entry set, and the method should return true.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns true when called on a collection with the same elements as the entry set.

    • testContainsAllMoreElements

      public void testContainsAllMoreElements()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns false when a collection with more elements is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns false when a collection with more elements is passed as an argument.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method is called with a collection (for this test another MapAdapter's EntrySet containing two entries: "key1"->"value1" and "key2"->"value2") that contains more elements than the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is empty, it should not contain all elements of the collection, and the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.containsAll(HCollection) method returns false when a collection with more elements is passed as an argument.

    • testAddAll

      public void testAddAll()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an HCollection.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an HCollection.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method is called with another MapAdapter's entry set on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the method is not supported by the entry set view it should throw an UnsupportedOperationException.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.addAll(HCollection) method throws an UnsupportedOperationException when called on an empty entry set.

    • testClear

      public void testClear()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method clears the entry set and leaves the underlying map empty.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method clears the entry set and leaves the underlying map empty.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is backed by the underlying map, clearing the entry set should also clear the map.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.clear() method clears the entry set and leaves the underlying map empty.

    • testEqualsSameSet

      public void testEqualsSameSet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns true when an entry set with the same entries is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns true when an entry set with the same entries is passed as an argument.
      Description
      A new empty MapAdapter instance is created, and its entry set is obtained. The MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method the new one. Since it contains the same entries (none), the method should return true.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns true when an entry set with the same entries is passed as an argument.

    • testEqualsDifferentSet

      public void testEqualsDifferentSet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns false when an entry set with different entries is passed as an argument.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns false when an entry set with different entries is passed as an argument.
      Description
      A new MapAdapter instance is created with an entry ("key", "value"). Its entry set is obtained, and the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method and the new one. Since it contains different entries, the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns false when an entry set with different entries is passed as an argument.

    • testEqualsNotASet

      public void testEqualsNotASet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is not an EntrySet.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is not an EntrySet.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method is called with a String and a ValueCollection as an argument on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the argument is not an EntrySet, the method should return false.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method returns false when the argument is not an EntrySet.

      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method. Since the entry set is empty, the method should return 0.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns 0 for an empty entry set.

    • testHashCodeDifferentSets

      public void testHashCodeDifferentSets()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns different hash codes for different entry sets.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns different hash codes for different entry sets when one is empty and the other contains elements.
      Description
      A new MapAdapter instance is created with an entry ("key", "value"). Its entry set is obtained, and the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method and the new one. Since the entry sets are different, the method should return different hash codes.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns different hash codes for different entry sets.

    • testHashCodeSameSet

      public void testHashCodeSameSet()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns the same hash code for the same entry set.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that the MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns the same hash code for the same entry set.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method and another instance of the same entry set. Since both instances are views of the same empty map, the method should return the same hash code.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method returns the same hash code for the same entry set.

    • testEqualsImpliesHashCode

      public void testEqualsImpliesHashCode()
      Tests that the MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method implies that the hash codes of the entry sets are equal.
      Design
      The test aims to verify that if two entry sets are equal, their hash codes should also be equal.
      Description
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method is called on the entry set created by the setUp() method with itself as an argument. Since it is the same entry set, the method should return true. The MapAdapter.AbstractView.hashCode() method is then called on both entry sets, and their hash codes should be equal.
      Preconditions
      The map and the entry set are correctly instantiated
      Postconditions
      The map is unchanged
      Expected Results
      The MapAdapter.EntrySet.equals(Object) method implies that the hash codes of the entry sets are equal.
